node.title: J integral in MOOSE
node.bodyText:
Hi @GiudGiud ,
I am currently trying to implement the J-integral in MOOSE. https://mooseframework.inl.gov/modules/tensor_mechanics/FractureIntegrals.html
Could you suggest if I read this correctly?
Example
[DomainIntegral]
  integrals = JIntegral
  boundary = '5000'
  crack_direction_method = CrackDirectionVector
  crack_direction_vector = '0 -1 0'
  radius_inner = 'a b c d'
  radius_outer = 'b c d e'
  output_variable = 'disp_x'
  output_q = false
  incremental = true
  symmetry_plane = 1
[]


boundary = '5000' : which boundary does this mean?
crack_direction_vector = '0 -1 0': It is the direction of the crack front
radius_inner = 'a b c d' radius_outer = 'b c d e': These are the start and end radius of the contours with centre at the crack tip. Please suggest.

5000 is the ID of the nodeset forming the crack
you can check the two other items by running the example. i think you are right on both

Hi @GiudGiud , thanks for the info, just a question.
I mostly make my model in ABAQUS and use the input file for the mesh.
In the examples in MOOSE, the input files are in .e format. Using Paraview I can only see the output, can you suggest how do I check the .e file to understand the commands for the mesh?
exodus files are mostly binary so you cant really examine how they were made.

node.title: Bubble Release in Liquid Metal
node.bodyText:
I am trying to run simulations for a UO2 fuel pellet in a liquid metal bonded fuel pin. As the fission gasses are released they will build up on the surface of the fuel pellet until the bubble is big enough and is released. I'm having trouble finding a physics model for simulating the bubbles releasing after they reach a given size. Has anyone worked with something like this or know which module would be best used for this problem?
TIA,
Adam

Hello
We are adding limited 2 phase capabilities. I dont think they will be enough for your problem but feel free to check them out.
It s a mixture model and it s hosted in the Navier Stokes module.
See the inputs in modules/navier_stokes/test/tests/finite_volume/two_phase/mixture_model
Guillaume

node.title: clarification on PorousFlowAqueousPreDisChemistry
node.bodyText:
Hello,
Could anyone please offer clarification on the following lines of code from PorousFlowAqueousPreDisChemistry?
https://github.com/idaholab/moose/blob/838e1c63f9aa3f6520da6639a2c8842eaf5366c3/modules/porous_flow/src/materials/PorousFlowAqueousPreDisChemistry.C#L350C4-L368C6
How did PorousFlow compute the "bounded" _reaction_rate[_qp][r]? Is it a derivative of some equation? Thank you.
@GiudGiud @cpgr
It s computed in that material. Seemingly the rate is simply back-computed from the change in another quantity. This expression also implicity assumes a 1st order scheme

I think it does a logic check to see if the concentration after the reaction would be outside the physical range [0,1], given the timestep size and computed reaction rate.  It the back-calculates a reaction rate to limit the concentration to these bounds, as @GiudGiud said.

node.title: Can peacock export a animation of a .e file?
node.bodyText: Can Peacock on Linux export/save an mp4/video file of my results(outputted as a .e file)? I am currently dual-booting and don't want to transfer my .e files onto Windows to load into Paraview. I am trying to avoid installing Paraview on Linux, as I have tried for a day and gave up.

I am sorry, but no... Peacock does not have this capability.
As for Paraview giving you grief on Linux, perhaps we can help with that? Honestly, I usually hear the opposite: Paraview works, but Peacock does not.
Paraview exists as a Conda package, if that helps? This is how I install it on my own machines (after installing the MOOSE Conda packages):
conda create -n paraview paraview
conda activate paraview
paraview
<eventually pops up on the screen>
If the above does not work, yet Peacock is "popping up" on the screen, I really can't fathom why Paraview would not.
Thank you, didnt know conda had Paraview as a package

Can you clean up the repo (save everything with git commit, then git clean -xfd) then try to compile again?

node.title: Not reading Physical Entities (Edges)
node.bodyText:
Hi,
I have created a 3D model in gmsh, and I am  trying to import it with FileMeshGenerator.
The file contains named faces and named edges (as Physical Entities). The faces are read without problem. The edges seem to be ignored.
I have read a similar discussion in Google Groups (which had an error in the gmsh file). So tried to compile the geo file from the command line (gmsh -3 infile.geo); no errors are shown and the exported msh file contains the named edges.
I attach my input files. The entity "bottom_edge" does not show in the moose model.
When I run mysolver-opt -i Q_model.i --mesh-only it doesnt seem to recognise the edge (Mesh Edgesets: None).
Any advice is much appriciated. Thanks!
(Attachments in zip, because the forum does not allow .i or .geo files)

It seems that when I apply the RenameBlockGenerator, it loses the defined face labels (edge-names are lost in any case).
Any way to bybass this error?
 [part2] type = FileMeshGenerator file = 'part2.msh' [] [part2_subdomain] type = SubdomainIDGenerator input = part2 subdomain_id = 2 []
The reason for needing the subdomains is that parts 1 & 2 have different elements, and I get an error about Exodus cant have different element type in same block id (something like that). By renaming the subdomains, I bypass Exodus error, but I lose the names of the faces (and therefore I cant apply BCs).

Hello
We keep track of sidesets and nodesets in MOOSe.
In 3D a sideset can only be 2D. So your edges have to be stored as nodesets instead, sets of nodes.
Guillaume

node.title: only reset one Multiapp Parameter in TransientMultiApp
node.bodyText:
Dear all,
I want to use 'Reset Multiapp Parameters' in [TransientMultiApp] to reset only one of two main variables in the sub-app. The
non-reset one within the sub-app is always inherited during the whole process.
However, the 'Reset Multiapp Parameters' will recreate all variables not only one variable. Another way may be to use global_time_offset to control several sub-apps starting every month in turn with the former sub-apps' final temperature as the initial condition. However, it needs many settings to start the sub-app and transfer data.
Could you please help me with this problem?
Thanks a lot.
B
The final answer in this issue #23945 can solve my problem. Thanks!

*** Warning ***
The following warning occurred in the object "to_sub", of type "MultiAppGeneralFieldShapeEvaluationTransfer".
On rank 0, multiple valid values from equidistant points were received for target variable 'a_res' for 1 target points.
Are some points in target mesh equidistant from the sources (nodes/centroids/apps/positions, depending on transfer) in origin mesh(es)?
Conflicts detected at :
In target child app 0 mesh, point: (-475.000000, -10.000000, -10.000000), equi-distance: 0.000000
How can I solve this warning problem?
Thanks a lot.
B

Hello
How many source applications are there?
It seems they overlap on that target point
Guillaume

Hi Guillaume,
Only one main app (3D cubic) and one sub app (1D line). The  3D cubic is centrally crossed by the 1D line. The transfer happens from the variable 'a' of the 3D main app to the aux variable 'a_res' of the 1D sub app as shown in the upper figure.

How many processes? on the main app and on the sub app.
I think maybe the target location (-475.000000, -10.000000, -10.000000) lies at the boundary between two elements in the main app?
You can use search_value_conflicts=false to silence it if the value received is consistently correcty.
Thanks for your tips. It works well so I can turn off this search_value_conflicts.

node.title: Polycrystalline Elasticity
node.bodyText:
Hi,
I am trying to write my own input script for uniaxial tension test of polycrystalline elasticity. In this script, the input .msh file was generated by NEPER. I followed the similar way that I have read for simulating polycrystalline plasticity tests. However, there are some error messages: "Material property 'elasticity_tensor', requested by 'stress' is not defined". The input files are attached here.
input files.zip
Could you please take a look and help me solve this issue? Thanks a lot!
Best,
Di

Hello
It's somewhat discouraged to download a random zip from the internet so could you please create a github repository and host your input files there.
You are missing a Material that defines the elasticity tensor.
For example that one:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/materials/ComputeElasticityTensor.html
Guillaume

Thanks for your reply. Can you be more specific on it? I have read the documentation and still cannot find the reason. The input script is shown:
#Run with 4 procs
[GlobalParams]
  displacements = 'disp_x disp_y disp_z'
  #volumetric_locking_correction = true
[]

[Mesh]
  construct_side_list_from_node_list=true
  [file]
    type = FileMeshGenerator
    file = 200-ori.msh
  []
  [split]
    type = BreakMeshByBlockGenerator
    input = file
  []
  [create_x0]
    type = BoundingBoxNodeSetGenerator
    input = split
    new_boundary = x0
    top_right = '0.001 1.001 1.001'
    bottom_left = '-0.001 -0.001 -0.001'
  []
  [create_y0]
    type = BoundingBoxNodeSetGenerator
    input = create_x0
    new_boundary = y0
    top_right = '1.001 0.001 1.001'
    bottom_left = '-0.001 -0.001 -0.001'
  []
  [create_z0]
    type = BoundingBoxNodeSetGenerator
    input = create_y0
    new_boundary = z0
    top_right = '1.001 1.001 0.001'
    bottom_left = '-0.001 -0.001 -0.001'
  []
  [create_z1]
    type = BoundingBoxNodeSetGenerator
    input = create_z0
    new_boundary = z1
    top_right = '1.001 1.001 1.001'
    bottom_left = '-0.001 -0.001 0.999'
  []
[]

[Variables]
  [./disp_x]
  [../]
  [./disp_y]
  [../]
  [./disp_z]
  [../]
[]

[Kernels]
  [./TensorMechanics]
  [../]
[]

[UserObjects]
  [./prop_read]
    type = ElementPropertyReadFile
    prop_file_name = '200-ori.inp'
    # Enter file data as prop#1, prop#2, .., prop#nprop
    nprop = 3
    read_type = grain
    ngrain = 200
  [../]
[]

[BCs]
  [./left_x1]
    type = DirichletBC
    variable = disp_x
    boundary = x0
    value = 0.0
  [../]
  [./left_x2]
    type = DirichletBC
    variable = disp_y
    boundary = y0
    value = 0.0
  [../]
  [./left_x3]
    type = DirichletBC
    variable = disp_z
    boundary = z1
    value = 0.0
  [../]
  [./right_x1]
    type = NeumannBC
    variable = disp_z
    boundary = z0
    value = -2.5e7
  [../]
[]

[Materials]
  [./elasticity_tensor]
    type = ComputeElasticityTensor
    C_ijkl = '5.93e10 2.57e10 2.14e10 5.93e10 2.14e10 6.15e10 1.64e10 1.64e10 1.68e10'
    base_name = 'euler'
    fill_method = symmetric9
    read_prop_user_object = prop_read
    [../]
    [./strain]
      type = ComputeSmallStrain
      #eigenstrain_names = eigenstrain
    [../]
    [./stress]
      type = ComputeLinearElasticStress
    [../]
  []

  [Preconditioning]
    [./smp]
      type = SMP
      full = true
    [../]
  []

  [Executioner]
    type = Steady

    petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -ksp_gmres_restart'
    petsc_options_value = 'lu       101'
    line_search = 'none'

    nl_abs_tol = 1e-11
    nl_rel_tol = 1e-10
    l_max_its = 30

  []

  [Outputs]
    exodus = true
  []

Thanks a lot!

You added a base_name to the Elasticity Tensor - producing material without adapting the other materials
comment it out and it will work
  [elasticity_tensor]
    type = ComputeElasticityTensor
    C_ijkl = '5.93e10 2.57e10 2.14e10 5.93e10 2.14e10 6.15e10 1.64e10 1.64e10 1.68e10'
    # base_name = 'euler'
    fill_method = symmetric9
    read_prop_user_object = prop_read
  []
Thanks a lot for your reply! However, I have tried the same operation, there is error message: unused parameter 'Materials/elasticity_tensor/read_prop_user_object'
that's unrelated. you need to check the parameters of that material
